website_summaries.verdict: Simple and convenient. A good telescope for first-timers or younger stargazers.
pros: Great light gathering, magnification, and precise positioning
A good entry-level refractor model telescope with handy accessories
cons: Magnification isn't as intense as some higher-end telescopes

customer_reviews.title: Meade Instruments infinity 60mm. AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: This telescope is awesome. It is the best choice for beginners to astronomy. It is very affordable and gives you the best bang for your buck. This telescope can see Jupiter and it's 4 moons, saturn, mars, and Venus. Not to mention the moon. Also, you can see the andromeda galaxy and the Orion Nebula. Those are just the highlights. You can see much, much more! I highly recommend this thing to everyone who is curious of what's out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Your party from Saturn has arrived, would you please give them a ring?
customer_reviews.text: My kids have really taken an interest in the night sky and this scope is perfect for that. They are 6 and 8 and I wanted a balance between being able to actually see things and not being super upset when it inevitably gets knocked over in the dark and smashed. This scope is the perfect balance. When the kids finally saw Saturn's rings and Jupiter's Galilean moons I knew they were hooked. I also appreciated that buying a Meade and not a toy scope would show any serious astronomer that we at least did our homework and weren't taken by the flashy magnification numbers.
customer_reviews.author: sn2000

customer_reviews.title: One of the best buys we've ever made.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my 17-year-old son and he loves it. A few nights ago he showed me Saturn and we were both thrilled to discover that we could see the RINGS around Saturn! This has whet his appetite for space exploration and maybe even a bigger telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Lorri Miller

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!  It broke in two months and Meade does not help
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift purchase for my son who loves space. A piece connecting the optical tube to the mount broke. It appears to be connected by some cheap glue. We cannot use the telescope now because the tube is loose and wobbly. I contacted Meade to set up a return. They informed me that they do not pay for return shipping. It costs $78 to return the telescope due to the size and the telescope costs $50 on Amazon. I explained the issue and the company said it cannot do anything. I’d strongly recommend not purchasing this item. If it breaks, you’re out of luck as it will cost more to return than the cost of the item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good, both for land and sky watching
customer_reviews.text: Very good, both for land and sky watching. Great to spot birds nests wildlife. Use the lower magnifications, you'll have a great and clear picture. Great also for Moon observation, you can clearly see Saturn's rings and other planets. The viewfinder with laser pointer is great, I suggest you calibrate it during the day on a tree or building detail, with maximum magnification, this will allow it to get to straight to the star or planet you want to observe at night.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Gioan

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect Eye Pieces Do Not Fit Telescope
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Meade Instruments Infinity 50mm AZ Refractor Telescope as a birthday gift for my son. Purchased well before his birthday because of a sale and not fully set up until months later (outside of the window to return/receive seller support), I was disappointed to find that the incorrect eye pieces were included. The ones we received do not actually attach the the telescope, thus it makes viewing anything virtually impossible. In order to use each eye piece, the operator must hold the eye piece in place. Bummer of a birthday gift for a little boy excited to explore space.
customer_reviews.author: M Bond

customer_reviews.text: I really was excited to finally get a telescope. It was a gift that I unexpectedly received and had not done any research on what kind to get. So I need to learn how to use the different lenses, adjustment knobs and laser scope. I can see close up parts of the moon but I wish could see at least a dime size view of the planets. Right now, I'm satisfied and need more time learning how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: kenpo saber

customer_reviews.title: I really like the red dot feature
customer_reviews.text: Well structured telescope. Solid overall construction. Comes in several section with assembly being no more than 15 or 20 minutes max, I really like the red dot feature. The 6.3mm eye loop has what appears to be a small "air bubble" defect embedded within the inside of the glass. I will most likely contact the manufacturer to see if they can replace it to keep a happy customer happy. I purchased it so I could share viewing the moon and other items with my 4 yr. old granddaughter. We have had fun.
customer_reviews.author: R. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This was quite a disappointment. Doesn't come with ANY instructions or information besides a dvd...we don't have a dvd player. There's no storage container and the assortment of lenses that came with it have no information on it either. I thought we'd just take it outside and look at the stars, but no...I can see the stars better when I'm not looking through it (and yes, we took on the cover on the end). Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: It’s big It’s impressive
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never owned a telescope. So I watched YouTube videos, read reviews, shaked the dice and got lucky. This is for my 14 year old nephew and we pre-set it up first became familiar with it and we are impressed. We live in a high rise in the city and it was fun and easy to use. Bought the book, dial and red flash light. He lives in the country and will enjoy this for many years to come. We can buy filters and lenses to add to his enjoyment in years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Big D Jorie

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Cannot seem to see anything through this. It was purchased for a 6 year old and seemed like a good starter model but we are all disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sa

customer_reviews.title: Great moon views, but not great for Saturn or Jupiter
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to see the rings around Saturn and bought this beginner's telescope to do so. It was relatively inexpensive and I had not done very much research. For the moon, it is awesome. You can see craters, etc. It is also good for bird watching. But it was extremely disappointing for watching Saturn and Jupiter (although I do not think that any telescope in this price range would be much better). They are little more than pinpricks and take a while to find with the scope. This is also not particularly useful for other heavenly objects. I'm not sure that I would buy it again, it was a learning experience.
customer_reviews.author: Disenchanted Buckeye

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: We have had this telescope for a year now and have never been able to successfully see anything. I have spent a large amount of time and energy trying to get this telescope to work to no avail. Everyone who comes in my house has messed with it and still... nothing. My kids have been very disappointed. As we are stationed overseas, sending it back wasn’t an option.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Eyepieces do not fit telescope.
customer_reviews.text: The Meade telescope came with eyepiece that did not fit. The replacement telescope had the same issue with the eyepiece not matching the telescope. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie Reid

customer_reviews.title: Saw jupiter and it's moon for the first time in my life.
customer_reviews.text: The instruction manual for setting this up could use cleaning up. The images which correspond to the steps provided are randomly placed creating some unnecessary confusion. The instruction themselves are easy to follow and understand. This was my very first telescope and something I have been meaning to get for a very long time. Once I had it set up, I managed to point it to Jupiter which was the first thing to appear. Seeing it's spherical shape along with it's four moons for the first time in my life was quite an experience. This telescope is really quite impressive for it's price and is definitely a great buy as a first telescope
customer_reviews.author: jcdeveloper

customer_reviews.title: I'm actually using this thing
customer_reviews.text: This is light years ahead of the telescope we had as kids; for my occasional backyard star gazing, this is perfect. The telescope was nicely packaged and protected. The assembly a bit intimidating, as Meade's printed instruction booklet could do with an upgrade (dark pictures; some too small to recognize parts; requires a good round of proofreading). My only complaint is that Meade includes an instructional CD - for PC only. You'd think this company would invest in cross-platform compatibility; think Mac computers!!
customer_reviews.author: DinNbpt

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I would like to say I understand not being able to see craters on the moon with this telescope however, it would be nice to see something other than complete blackness no matter what we look at. My husband and I both thoroughly inspected this to try and determine if we had a cap on somewhere that made it so you cant see but thats not the case. Now we have a $45 piece of crap that our kids were super excited about for Christmas and cant even use it. Heres my advice, spend more and get something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Jeffery

customer_reviews.title: Nice little beginner telescope.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little beginner telescope. My son and I have used it a couple of times. I did not expect much considering how inexpensive it was but it works well. You just need a really dark spot and some patience to get it ready. My son is 7 and not all that patient though, haha.
customer_reviews.author: Myron TTop Contributor: Lego

customer_reviews.title: Good telescope and lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter and son-in-law live in Massachusetts and like to stargaze, but it's not dark enough for them to see what they want. We live in the country where it is very dark, so they like watching the stars whenever they visit. Bought this for them to use when they are here. They were extremely excited when they saw it and couldn't wait to try it out. They spent many hours enjoying it the whole time they were here last week. Very happy with this purchase, since they are enjoying it so much! Hubby and I have used it some, but the kids are the ones that really have a blast using it!
customer_reviews.author: SAMP

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for astronomical and terrestrial viewing
customer_reviews.text: Great optics. The spotting gismo is great but remember to turn it off the battery is very small The tripod is heave and strong the pan head is smooth and stable. The slowmotion controls are smooth as well. The 25 mm eyepiece is not as good as the SVBONY 25mm I bought for a friend. For terrestrial viewing the pan head does not allow a tilt down more than dead level. There is a mechanical stop that I had to cut down to allow a slight tilt down. I can hardly wait for good viewing to see saturn and jupiter.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Fling

customer_reviews.title: Very decent first telescope
customer_reviews.text: Bought 90mm Meade to show kids moon and stars. Our whole family was amazed by how much you can see in this simple, cheap telescope. Tons of fun. Saturn and rings, Jupiter with 4 moons, Moon in very hi-res, with all the details. I'm sure if you spend more money you'll get more details, but if this is your budget - it's still very usable. Skies are amazing!
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: For the sweet love of Moses
customer_reviews.text: For the sweet love of Moses. The eyes pieces I received are 1.25" but the triangular prism diameter is 1". I explained the problem and returned it for a new set to only have the exact same problem. This is sloppy work and a waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lufkin

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for a first telescope
customer_reviews.text: This is more than just a "children's telescope." Good choice to see if you enjoy the field. Chinese made, apparently American engineered. Great value. No issues. Looks great next to a living room window with views of the local hillsides! I'm quite impressed; I could see the tripod that comes with it as possibly costing or at least worth $30!! --- And yes you can take the telescope off the tripod and use the tripod for something else! By the way, there is a plastic part on the mirror piece that must first be removed for the eyepieces to fit! I almost emailed Meade before I discovered that the part has to be taken out first.
customer_reviews.author: craigery

customer_reviews.title: I love this scope never owned a telescope except a toy ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this scope never owned a telescope except a toy one several years ago. Assembled in 10 minutes or less went out during the day and aligned the red scope finder very easy. The first night saw Jupiter and it's moons a few night later viewed Saturn all with the come with eyepieces. I have now upgraded and purchased a new 2xBarlow and two Plossl eyepieces all Meade products. Last night 6/5/17 after several days of clouds and rain went out with new Barlow and 15mm Plossl and saw Jupiter and it's moons it was very sharp could see all the bands it was better than a picture.
customer_reviews.author: Danny S.

customer_reviews.title: really good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool for kids not something pros would use. I really recommend this one, don't even bother with the lesser 60 mm. You can see Jupiter but don't expect any deep details. we can see the moon in detail however. I do recommend this kids to get very excited however they will move around the telescope so you'll have to keep searching for the moon over and over again. It does have a locking but with kids they will lift up and move it anyways. happy stargazing
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: All things positive with this product.
customer_reviews.text: This nice sized telescope was a great purchase that we made. Was easy to assemble, not overly bulky, and light enough for it to be portable. Clear quality , and got the job done with us star gazing from where we live , just darkness at night, no lights , so can really get a good look at the stars, planets, and moon.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Beginner Telescope
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our 9 year old grand daughter. Pop-pop put it together, that was relatively painless. We use it look at the planets on clear evenings. Educational but you should purchase a decent sky book that's geared at kids. The grand daughter enjoys it but needs some supervision at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Clear image and easy to stabilize.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great telescope for looking at the moon (which is the main reason I got it) but it also has a 2X Barlow lens that lets you see pretty far. I have used the Barlow to get a close look at Mars and some cool star clusters. You cannot see details on the surface of Mars but it's pretty close. Also, the aluminum legs make it pretty stable so there's no shaking of the image as long as it's not windy.
customer_reviews.author: James Gill

customer_reviews.title: Good value but flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, don't rush it! The 90 prism reflector is extremely fragile, so the threads stripped and the plastic cowling around the maintube connector came off. Should never have a iPhone mount or other astrophotography add-on used on the eyepiece because this 90 piece is such a weak link. Attached are photos for Meade quality control: 1)stripped threads on 90deg prism housing 2) inner element tube badly scratched Good image, ok value, but would not recommend purchase. Amazon very willing to resolve but I'll just use some super glue and plumber's tape on the threads.
customer_reviews.author: James MacCloskey

customer_reviews.title: I have the celestron lens kit with case and the optics are far better than the supplied lens
customer_reviews.text: This telescope is fairly decent for amateur use. The optics are cheap quality and the tripod legs don't extend high enough,even though I'm a short person I still have to bend over too far to aim the finder scope which works well. This scope has a lot of plastic and the dew shield is too large. I have the celestron lens kit with case and the optics are far better than the supplied lens. Using the celestron lens kit has improved the resolution. This telescope is not for deep sky viewing but does a decent job when looking at the moon and planets. Aside from the few complaints I'm satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Finamore

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t Work
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. This was a prize for our 4th grade daughter who received straight A’s. We waited nearly a month for this telescope to arrive. Sadly there is something wrong with the stand and we can’t even use it.
customer_reviews.author: JMama18

customer_reviews.title: 102mm is very easy to use for beginner, and very happy with the views
customer_reviews.text: The telescope and stand are easy to assemble, you almost don't need any instructions. It is intuitive to use after a little practice. You can see great images of Saturn, Jupiter and its moons, Orion Nebula, and very detailed image of the moon. I am very happy with this telescope. The only negative I have is that the focus is very coarse. It works fine with the lower powered lenses, but with the higher powered lenses it is very difficult to focus. I would not think it would add much cost to put smaller teeth on the focus, so it would be a bit finer.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Not what they say in the write up
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup however this is a beginning level telescope bordering toy or hobby level. If you expect to be able to focus clearly and have a clear picture this is not what you want. If you want to see the moon fairly clear and only outline of some closer planets then this is a reasonable buy. I now wish I would saved and put twice the money for a real telescope ugh. Works for both sky and terrestrial viewing. * the high power eye piece is garbage and is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!! A must have! Very happy
customer_reviews.text: So I have a lot of great things to say about this telescope. I was buying it for my boyfriend because he wanted to explore the stars and the moon. So I read some reviews on this telescope and it got pretty good reviews. I ordered it and it came early! And the set up was really easy. They give you a dvd and a handbook on how to set it up. Also I should add that its HUGE 😊 I didn't think that the telescope would be that big. It's an amazing telescope and im sooooo glad I purchased it. It was great on everything.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie T.

customer_reviews.title: Start here!
customer_reviews.text: Since I was having trouble programming one of the larger (for me) more spiffy, computerized telescopes, I decided to buy this simpler, four-inch refractor, on sale for about 20% off. Easily assembled, easily transported to a nearby parking lot, I saw Venus (a half-crescent) and Jupiter with four of its moons on my first try. I did not use a strong eyepiece at the time and hence saw few details of Jupiter. Before long, I hope to really find out what this scope can do. By way of information, the Meade 102AZ has received very favorable critique for its price level on the Cloudy Nights web site. This is definitely a good starter model for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: T. McRae

customer_reviews.title: Great Beginner Scope
customer_reviews.text: First time using a telescope and the very first thing we saw was Jupiter and 3 of it's moons. Granted not crisp and clear, but so excited. Takes some time to learn which lenses are best for what you want to see. I didn't have the phone attachment at first. The quality and magnification is much better without it. But it's fun to use. Took some nice video of the clouds passing over the moon. I love that this telescope is easy to set up and take off the tripod. We took it camping. We'll look into higher quality lenses next.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Karol

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, powerful lense
customer_reviews.text: A gift to the family to use together for my 9 and 11 year old grandchildren. The family have had a great time being together outside looking at what the sky had to offer. My son said it was very powerful for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This telescope was recommended by a science professor who had purchased it for ...
customer_reviews.text: This telescope was recommended by a science professor who had purchased it for his child. My grandson loves it (so does his dad :( ) and looks through it every night. He is only six but learning a lot . I would highly recommend this for children and adults for their first telescope It definitely was better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Preno

customer_reviews.title: The 102mm Meade Infinity is an excellent telescope. Got it for our son but everyone ...
customer_reviews.text: The 102mm Meade Infinity is an excellent telescope. Got it for our son but everyone loves using it. The included 6.3mm eyepiece's eye relief and field of view make it extremely difficult to use though. The 9mm and 26mm are much more forgiving. We ended up buying the full range of Agena (or Astro) Starguider eyepieces and have been pleasantly surprised at what this telescope and those eyepieces allows us to see!
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very cheaply made. Lesson learned, you get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: 70mm telescope
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the eclipse and was looking at products to make a DIY mount for my camera. When the telescope arrived I was elated to find out that it has threading for a 42x0.75 t-mount adaptor! There is no need for a DIY project and the image looks great on my SLR! This telescope made my day!
customer_reviews.author: moiven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a perfect telescope. My husband got it for our 6 years old boy. It’s winter right now, so we were not able to e joy it too much. We are outdoor people, so we are looking for this summer to enjoy when camping.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: My wife's favorite christmas present
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife because she loves the moon, I didn't expect much because I've never had great luck with telescopes but the day we sat this thing up we must have gazed through it for 6 hours, sighting it in was relatively easy just find a chimney far away and align your finder scope, we saw the moons surface during broad daylight, and it was even more impressive after sunset, as well as got a decent view of venus... for the price you can't beat it. I'm already scoping out a dobsonian for next year because it's so amazing to look at these planetary bodies
customer_reviews.author: Robert Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Used as a solar projection scope during the last eclipse, then gave to friend with young children. Worked very well projecting onto a white board under a large shading umbrella. Gave a very distinct (could easily see sunspots) 10-11 inch image. Friends and their children love it. Just be aware that this is a manual az/el mount and requires manual tracking on both axis.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: decent product dumb operator
customer_reviews.text: Complicated to assemble. Got it for my wife as part of present where I named a star after her and got a certificate with a star map to be able to locate it. Long story short I am no telescope expert and still have not been able to get it to work properly. However I do believe this us operator error and not the fault of the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: mrtdrew

customer_reviews.title: Nice little telescope for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's not often we get clear sky's during the winter in Ohio, but when we do, I take my boy outside to look at the stars and moon with his new telescope. He has them plastered all over his room, so he got so excited when he got this for Christmas. I would rather him use this and learn science than staring at an iPad all day. View is clear, and actually has some power to see the moon up close. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Review Zone

customer_reviews.title: Terrific telescope.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson has been very happy with this telescope. He was super excited to receive it and it has not disappointed him. He found it to be easy to use - he is a smart 11-yr old - for his first telescope.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tested it at night, but at the default lens it's pretty good during the day. Attached are three photos, One of them is through the telescope, showing a street sign far away, one's from my phone, pointed at the same place, with a red circle drawn on the area, and one's of the telescope as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: BUSHMAN FAMILY

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and fun hobby!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a birthday gift. He was using the iPad to map the stars in the sky....now he loves this telescope. Since we are both beginners, the directions were easy to follow. So now we are watching our skies. The color blue is beautiful and looks great in our Arkansas Room.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: I was Amazed at first glance. Great first scope!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first telescope and couldn't be happier. Yes the scope shakes but this only happens when your trying to focus and its only really noticeable when you're using the highest strength eyepiece. You can actually see the strips on Jupiter with this scope and I wasn't using the Barlow. In fact I haven't found a use for the Barlow yet but I will keep trying. Read the direction and learn how to use this TOOL before you even set it up. Remember the first thing your kindergarten teacher taught you? Read the directions first.
customer_reviews.author: JumpARooJack

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Quality of product was sub par. Eye piece came bent, and you can see blue paints are already came with chips all around. This was the highlight of camping trip with my kids. Unfortunately, it was a complete opposite. Extremely dissapointed. I do not recommend a buy, build quality is unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Starter Telescope
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a quality beginner telescope to use with my kids. This really hit the mark. It arrived well-packaged in the manufacturer's box. It just took a few minutes to set up and we were quickly able to look at some stars the first evening and Jupiter the next morning. We could faintly make out some of the bands on Jupiter with the 4mm eyepiece. The adjustment knobs are very helpful and something that made this telescope stand out from some of the others I looked at.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ashbrook

customer_reviews.title: Cheap  Chinese unk
customer_reviews.text: Cheap parts were not Chrome completely unfortunately assembly could not be finished. Contacted Mead sent receipt promised part never sent. To late to return. Pure junk.
customer_reviews.author: michael g California Kid

customer_reviews.title: Expensive paper weight
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy this telescope! Got it for my son for Christmas and broke with 5 minutes beyond repair. Contacted Amazon and said it was past the window to return it. Contacted Meade and when I explained what happened she literllay laughed at me and said I shouldn't have bought a cheap model. It was $80 which is kinda cheap but not really.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: Would be nice if there were more instructions. Can’t quite get a clear picture and due to lack of instructions I’m a bit afraid to try and swap out lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Dillon

customer_reviews.title: So far the moon and Jupiter were easy to locate
customer_reviews.text: The viewfinder makes it a breeze to focus on objects in the sky. We are looking forward to seeing Saturn later this month. So far the moon and Jupiter were easy to locate. Star gazing on a clear night is pretty awesome. For beginners this is a great telescope. I also purchased the Gosky Universal Cell Phone Adapter Mount so my 3 year old can view.
customer_reviews.author: Keshia

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the moon??
customer_reviews.text: This telescope came w/ very little instruction. The ‘instructional’ dvd it came with was possibly made in the early 90’s. Wasn’t even for the same model telescope! No joke & not helpful. The reviews & dvd claimed how easy it is to use but we’ve had it a wk & we still haven’t even been able to find the moon!
customer_reviews.author: yami richardson rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great view for price
customer_reviews.text: I put a Meade 14mm ultra wide angle eyepiece in and the view was great, wow though the tripod struggled some because the eyepiece weights as much as the scope
customer_reviews.author: Michelle A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves it. He was so excited to look for stars and stuff. He is turning 11 and this was for his birthday. Well made. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: gmamontana

customer_reviews.title: Good Scope
customer_reviews.text: Good scope for general viewing.Easy and quick set up outside. Mount is useless and hard to use. Transferred over to my Celestron GoTo mount. I didn't realize till recently this scope takes 2" eyepieces also. That is nice!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Meade Telescope
customer_reviews.text: Quality made product , easy to set up , you can see the 4 moons on Jupiter , you can see the Rings on Saturn .a little sensitive to the touch while focusing . all in all I'm Satisfied with my purchase .Thanks
customer_reviews.author: M. Evanich

customer_reviews.title: Meade Infinity 90mm Telescope
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased this excellent piece of equipment for my wife (who is in love with Astronomy and the Universe). She loves it and is using it almost every night when the stars are out and the sky is clear! Very sharp image with several different lens and adapters. We would highly recommend any one who is shopping for a home telescope to check out the Meade Instruments - you will be very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Paul T Brown II

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to keep steady even after locating object. Extremely shaky and tightening knobs side around. Not recommended aside from looking at full moon. My 4 yr old gets frustrated and loses interest fast.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it
customer_reviews.text: My son (8) wished for a telescope for Christmas. This is great to look at the moon. I added a few pictures I took through the lense. It is not easy to figure out how to find the moon at first but once you get the hang of it, it’s really fun. We got to watch the lunar eclipse / blood moon a couple weeks ago. It was pretty cool! I haven’t tried seeing any planets yet.
customer_reviews.author: Katharina

customer_reviews.title: Great customer support
customer_reviews.text: My review is not about the quality of the telescope because I have no experience to compare this one to. I want to talk about the customer service. When we had trouble assembling the lens I contacted Meade by email. Before the end of the day I received a response. We exchanged a few emails, I sent a few photos and within 3 days I had a new lens assembly delivered to my door. Everything fits properly... let the star gazing begin. Every company I deal with should have the customer support that Meade offered me.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Worth more than the price they sell it at!
customer_reviews.text: Much bigger than I was expecting! Got to see the beautiful moon in fine detail the day I got this. Every part comes in a bag or box or bubble wrap that is marked, and the booklet to put it together lists the pieces, but I completely ignored it and went head on halfway without the instructions and put it together pretty easily. This thing is so cool!
customer_reviews.author: PartySuvius

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner telescope
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. He was amazed at the detail he could see in the moon and that we could look at other planets. Supposedly can see the rings on Saturn but that hasn't been in our evening sky yet.
customer_reviews.author: A-A-Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: An incredible telescope for the price. Was able to view the four moons of Jupiter as four white dots around the planet. Not able to see the rings but very Awesome for the price for a telescope that will open up the sky for night time viewing. Also Awesome to use to view the mountains around my home.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lee Watson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent starter telescope
customer_reviews.text: Love this telescope. I bought it for my 6 year old son for his birthday. When we opened this up, it was a pleasant surprise that is was a big as it was. We brought it out that night and got a crystal clear view of the moon. This is an excellent product for the price and very easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Valente

customer_reviews.title: buy something better
customer_reviews.text: don't don't don't because what you can see you see same thing with it. You can't see anything except moon. By the way you don't need it for watch moon THANK YOU
customer_reviews.author: beykozmak

customer_reviews.title: The 102mm works like a dream
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is very interested in space. Her birthday was coming up and said a telescope was the only birthday present she wanted. We went online and found the 102mm which was perfect. Blue, easy to use, and has great reviews. It's been working for the last two months but the red dot viewfinder broke. Meade was very nice and replaced it free of charge as they have a 1-year warranty. The viewfinder came in the mail today with an extra battery, too! We can see Saturn's rings, Jupiter's moons, a star cluster, the moon, and more. It really is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! For my 5th grade classroom during science lessons, this is great for students to view and make connections to the actual tool not just a picture of a telescope! Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Sam D

customer_reviews.title: Easy for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and take down! And great for me and my son (5) to use together as beginners. It comes with multiple lenses but all are very basic. We plan on buying more once we get better at using the telescope. It's a learning process! Lol. All in all it's a sturdy peice and we love it!
customer_reviews.author: bupton03

customer_reviews.title: Spend the same for more power with something else
customer_reviews.text: Product was exactly as it described. For the price I would recommend you buy a higher magnification telescope for roughly the same price range. We can see the moon clearly bit it is not powerful enough to see planets. After some research you need higher magnification for that.
customer_reviews.author: Tabbatha Johns

customer_reviews.title: Beginner telescope
customer_reviews.text: Definitely beginners telescope focuser does not quite fine tune But as far as the scope you can grab and use real quick it is fine
customer_reviews.author: Carl Lans

customer_reviews.title: Great little telescope.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son, so this review is second hand, but he loves it. I also included a book of 50 things to look at with a telescope and he is searching the skies on clear evenings and says he amazed at what he can see. I recommend this telescope for any beginner based on the joy it has given my boy.
customer_reviews.author: Al41

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope
customer_reviews.text: Meade 102mm it's a great telescope first night out I saw Jupiter and it's bands with three moons, Saturn with its rings, and the moon. I also looked at Vega. The tripod is pretty sturdy doesn't shake too much only when you adjust it. Assembly was a breeze. The red dot finder scope makes finding things easier I haven't gotten it fully accurate but got it close enough to find it with in 5-10 seconds. A great telescope for beginners or even amateur. Update the more I use it the more I love it you can see clusters and some galaxies. But I would recommend upgrading the lenses
customer_reviews.author: Celies73

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This relescope is exactly what is descripted. The tripod is much taller then expected which was a plesant surprise since this was a gift for my husband. We have been able to see the moon at different phases, we've seen jupiter, mars, and many many stars. We've even bird watched during the day. The views are superb. Great product and great price. Thank you Meade and thank you Amazon for lightening fast delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Hotroddin

customer_reviews.title: Scope will drift when facing up high in sky
customer_reviews.text: The scope is too heavy and drifts when it's pointed high in the sky. It's good for viewing things from horizon level to about 45 degrees up. Past that, you might catch it drifting off the target.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I hope I got a defective one...
customer_reviews.text: The finderscope was nowhere near accurate. The Telescope itself wouldn't even focus in on anything during the day. I've used plenty of telescopes and this one is the only one i couldn't see ANYTHING with. Disappointing Christmas present for my 8 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Weiser

customer_reviews.title: Excellent telescope
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my grandson as a birthday present..he got interested in looking at the stars during the last lunar eclipse..he loves it..my son and grandson have been using it almost every night
customer_reviews.author: Deborah DuVall

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Came with a chip out of the paint in the tube. The alt az mount operates more like a sticky door in an old cabin. Extreme chromatic aberration. Not what I was expecting from Meade. Would send it back if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Terry York

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding telescope! 4” eye!
customer_reviews.text: Holy smokes what a great telescope! Amazing optics 4” huge eye, great mount and well built! Really good looking too! Compact and not overwhelming in size. I have owned Meade before and they have only improved! Simple telescope for the simple user! This is not a go to mount. It’s a super simple mount. Comes with some great eye pieces and a Barlow lens. Super cool res dot sight for ease of locating objects. For the beginner...Read the instructions and get familiar with the telescope! It will reduce frustration!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great telescope, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews cover it well, just adding that a moon filter would be helpful to get as well because it's really bright! I held my hand a few inches away from the eyepiece and could see a distinct moon shape on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Mullen

customer_reviews.title: No good.
customer_reviews.text: I can see better with my naked eye. Not worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Mama2bear

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Really cheap spend a bit more for a better product
customer_reviews.author: Y_not-woke

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid telescope and tri-pod stand.
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid telescope and tri-pod stand. Bought as an end of school gift for a 14 year old. Did set up before gifting, thought the image was clear and the stand was sturdy, and the whole setup is light enough to be easily moved. There was a shipping delay, but KUDOS to Amazon support team, the telescope arrived the day before school was out, Many Thanks, Happy Amazon Customer...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 70mm as my first telescope. It was easy to assemble and I spotted Venus, Mars, Saturn, and Jupiter plus four of its moons in the first 30 minutes of using it. It's also great for viewing the craters on the moon or constellations. Takes a little practice to focus and keep it steady, but I recommend it for beginners looking for an affordable option.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids 6-10yrs old great 1st Scope to introduce them to our skies
customer_reviews.text: Christmas Gift for grandson. Great way to get them away from Television & PC's while letting them in on great wonders of our world
customer_reviews.author: R.Watford

customer_reviews.title: Great Scope for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Nice scope. Laser sight is accurate and easy to use. Much better than the “rifle” spotting scopes on the refractors I grew up with.
customer_reviews.author: Desperado

customer_reviews.title: Great introductory scope for kids--opens their eyes to the night sky.
customer_reviews.text: Grandsons and their Papa really enjoy this scope. They now watch for and key in on planet events and various phases of the moon. I love that they are developing an awareness of the great world and sky around them.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Lou Blanchfield

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids or beginners like me
customer_reviews.text: Decent for the money don't expect much from it. Great for kids or beginners like me. Only issues I have with it is the finders scope is out of wack upside down blurry just throw it away. And the scope itself is shaky you'll have a hard time getting it to steady you'll have to look through it without holding onto it or it continuesly shakes bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsure
customer_reviews.text: I felt like this was difficult to master and it caused my son to lose interest as I sat around and watched dvds on how to use the thing!! Finally figured it out used it for a week saw the moon and maybe 2 stars and never touched it again
customer_reviews.author: Sapphire W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The assembly instructions could be a little more thorough. The telescope worked as expected and has perfect functionality.
customer_reviews.author: GeminiAM

customer_reviews.title: Infiniti telescope
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my wife wanted for Mother’s Day. Can adapt to her camera for her to take photos of the moon and sunset.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel N. OConnor

customer_reviews.title: I was super excited. The telescope works fine
customer_reviews.text: This being my first telescope, I was super excited. The telescope works fine, and is a good value for the money. But there are some small things that hold it back. The worst of which is that it wobbles. Once you find something to look at, even something big like the moon, if you let go of the telescope, it wobbles out of position. So basically you either have to compensate for the wobble or continue to hold the scope while looking through the lens. Once you do get it to stay still, there is some super cool stuff to look at. And for the price it's hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A basic scope
customer_reviews.text: Basically a beginner scope, good for planets. The mount and controls are not smooth and since the scope is light weight there is a lot of jerky movement. The red dot finder is a plastic piece of junk that does work at all for small objects.
customer_reviews.author: MikeInTexas

customer_reviews.title: Just point at the sky and be prepared to sleep in the next day.
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected. Bought this because it was easy to set up. Have taken it on multiple camping trips with no fuss. Once you figure out the best lens combo for what you're looking at it give a pretty good view. Can easily see the cloud bands on Jupiter and the ring of Saturn. Best thing to do is point it at a random spot in the Milky Way and let the stars come to you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Very very cheaply made and there was a part missing. Would never recommend this to anyone .
customer_reviews.author: P b

customer_reviews.title: Sweet telescope!
customer_reviews.text: Got the 102mm model, very powerful. Some minor assembly required. Can see squirrels or planets, birds or stars. Comes with an awesome tripod and extra lenses. This thing is built solid and it seems that Meade really cares about quality. Best price for a telescope of this power, you won't regret it if you want so see some celestial happenings!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

product_meta.title: Meade Instruments – Infinity 60mm Aperture, Portable Refracting Astronomy Telescope for Kids & Beginners – Multiple Eyepieces & Accessories Included – STEM Activities for Children & Adults
product_meta.description:
Style:Infinity - 60mmIdeal for the observer who views both astronomical and terrestrial objects, the Meade Infinity Series combines an altazimuth mount and quality optics for a superb value. For newcomers and beginners alike, these refracting telescopes are a great way for you to discover the cosmos and the outdoors.​ You’ll discover more with the Meade Infinity Series. The Meade Infinity 60 Refractor telescope is an excellent telescope to introduce a younger audience to astronomy. This 60mm (2.4") aperture gives bright, sharp images for both land and celestial objects. Whether you're viewing the lunar craters, rings of Saturn, the moons of Jupiter, or terrestrial objects, the Infinity 60 Refractor allows the first-time observer to explore the world, solar system, and beyond.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Meade Infinity 60 Altazimuth Refractor Telescope comes complete with everything you need to view the wonders of the night sky the first time out. 60mm (2.4") Refracting Telescope delivers bright and detailed images that is perfect for viewing both land and celestial objects. Features an Altazimuth mount with slow motion control rod for tracking celestial objects as they move across the night sky. Comes with 2 eyepieces that provide low and high powered magnification for viewing a wide range of objects (Moon, planets, or land). Bonus Autostar Suite Astronomy planetarium DVD with over 10,000 celestial objects (Windows PC only). One Year Warranty.
feature_bullets: Aperture: 60mm(2.4"). focal length: 800mm. Focal Ratio: f/13.3. Rack-and-pinion Focuser
Altazimuth mount with a slow motion control rod for precision tracking means you can easily track objects day or night
Low (26mm) and high (6.3mm) magnification eyepieces give you variety for any viewing situation & 2x Barlow lens doubles the magnifying power of each eyepiece
Red dot viewfinder helps you point your scope at objects you want to observe & accessory tray stores accessories while observing
Includes astronomical software and instructional DVD

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,215 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
